results.title: We're gonna have recess (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, William Canning and Michael Scott
results.brief_description: To smile at the antics of children in a playground is to smile at oneself. This is a candid camera view of the schoolyard during recess, when hearts are broken, scores settled, secrets told, and where a bouncing ball or a turning rope can still tell the future to a chanted rhyme. Filmed without commentary, this is a small world and a brief one, but a world of childhood that everyone will recognize. Film without words.

results.title: We'll show you what we're gonna do
results.brief_description: Shows the operation of an art program designed to teach eighteen blind, partially sighted, and additionally handicapped children. Suitable for tertiary/teacher level.

results.title: Wayward girls & wicked women. - Volume 3.
results.brief_description: This is the final part of a three volume series featuring the best of world animation by women. The three films included have been recognised for their ground breaking qualities and make witty and provocative use of the myths, fairytales, and sexual iconography that have affected the way women have been seen - and see themselves. Featuring: Asparagus/Susan Pitt; The Decision/Vera Neubauer; The Brooch Pin and the Sinful Clasp/Joanna Woodward.

results.title: Wayward girls & wicked women. - Volume 2.
results.brief_description: Unlike the world of live action feature films, animation is a form of filmmaking in which women, particularly over the last two decades, have made an enormous impact. This second part of the series aims to give a taste of the range of voices and styles in contemporary animation. Some of the films are intensely personal, some give new, relevant life to the phrase “the personal is the political”, some re-invent the comic cartoon but all are truly original pieces of animation. Titles include: Fatty Issues/Candy Guard; The Door/Nina Shorina; The Stain/Marjut Rimminen & Christine Roche; Delivery Man/Emily Hubley; Daddy’s Little Bit of Dresden China/Karen Watson; You Be Mother/Sarah Pucill; Wishful Thinking/Candy Guard; Greek Tragedy/Nicole van Goethem; The Interview/Caroline Leaf & Veronica Soul; Girls’ Night Out/Joanna Quinn.

results.title: Wayward girls & wicked women. - Volume 1.
results.brief_description: Unlike the world of live action feature films, animation is a form of filmmaking in which women, particularly over the last two decades, have made an enormous impact. This first in a series aims to give a taste of the range of voices and styles in contemporary animation. Some of the films are intensely personal, some reinvent the comic cartoon but all are truly original pieces of animation. Titles include: Feet of song/Erica Russell; Two sisters/Caroline Leaf; Alternative fringe/Candy Guard; Springfield/Emma Calder; Emergence of Eunice/Emily Hubley; Poodle/Nina Shorina; A little something/Candy Guard; Murders most foul/Gillian Lacey; Some protection/Marjut Rimminen; Full of grace/Nicole Van Goethem; Second class mail/Alison Snowden.

results.title: Ways of water
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Gregory Heimer
results.brief_description: Examines the undisturbed nature of water, explaining the difference forms as ice, streams, dew, mist, rain, clouds and the sea. Shows the relationship between water and the forests, insects, fish, birds and other elements. Filmed at the Olympic National Park in the State of Washington, USA.

results.title: Ways of thinking
results.brief_description: In a remote Central Australian community, a young Warlpiri couple are in conflict. Jean Napanangka wants to stay with her people, but her husband, Alan Jungarrayi, wants to move to the town to find work. Jean fears if they leave, their children will lose their language, and, because theirs is an orally-transmitted culture, their traditional identity as well. When the white man arrived in Australia, there were at least 200 Aboriginal languages. Only 40 survive today. This video is a timely examination of the dilemma faced by Aboriginal people wanting to control the fate of their heritage.

results.title: Wayne's World
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Lorne Michaels and Penelope Spheeris
results.brief_description: A hilarious spoof where teenagers Wayne Campbell (Mike Myers) and Garth Algar (Dana Carvey) take on a sleazy TV executive (Rob Lowe) after his offer of a huge contract to tape their late night cable access show. After starting at the network it quickly becomes apparent that the road to the big time is hardly what it seems. At first a cause for celebration, Wayne and Garth’s progress to public success soon threatens the philosophy of genuine fun and enjoyment the two promote, and threatens Wayne’s attempts to win over rock musician Cassandra (Tia Carrerre). A non-stop comedy with a sincere twist, this film is tightly scripted by Myers and Bonnie and Terry Turner and can be well appreciated at many levels.

results.title: Wayleggo
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Geoffrey Scott, Oxley Hughan and Robert Kingsbury
results.brief_description: Shows some activities of a mountain sheep station in New Zealand, including training of dogs and the Autumn muster to move sheep below the snow line.
